args: Several days after the raid on Galkin's lair\nSvenitla Royal Palace

Galkin has escaped. Stupid as he was,
he clearly foresaw this possibility, and has
likely hidden his remaining forces in some
other location.
We'll need to take extra care moving\nforward. Now then, how are the injured\nAlberian soldiers?
The two who breathed the mist are now\nundergoing treatment and expected to live.\nAs for General Valyx...
Still unconscious. That incident in the\nmine pushed him to the very edge.

Even after breathing in that mist, he still
shapeshifted and was buried alive to
protect the people under his command.
He simply pushed himself too far.
He and {player_name} both are\nwilling to push themselves to the brink\nin the service of others.
However different they may be,\nthey remain brothers.
But that just makes Valyx's actions all the\nmore strange. What possible reason did\nhe have for staying with the Empire?
...Valyx told me not to say more\nthan I needed to.
But I think you have a right to know\nwhy he stayed—and also what he did.
Follow me, all of you! This day, we ensure\nthe evildoers face their final judgment!
These events occurred in the days after the\nKingdom of Alberia became the Dyrenell Empire.

My troops and I were returning to the capital
after a long excursion when we encountered
a force who called themselves soldiers of the
Dyrenell Empire.
We subdued them and stopped their attack on a\nvillage. I was stunned to see they were led by an\nAlberian general who I knew quite well.
You swore fealty to Alberia, General!\nWhy do you now raid villages under the\nbanner of the Dyrenell Empire?!
You've been away for a long time,\nold friend. The Kingdom of Alberia IS\nthe Dyrenell Empire now!
We raided that village under orders from\nyour father, Emperor Aurelius. This was\nan official military action.
If you doubt me, arrest me and bring me\nback to the capital. You'll quickly see the\ntruth of my words then.
All was as he said: The Kingdom of Alberia\nhad transformed into the Dyrenell Empire.
The general was set free, and I was accused of\ninterfering with an official military operation.\nBut when I voiced protestations to my father...

I understand that you wish to strengthen
our national power by taking over new
regions and gaining control of the whole
of South Grastaea.
But I cannot sanction the way we are\ndoing so through military means rather\nthan continued negotiations.

Do you really expect self-governed cities
and villages would cede control to us?
No, my son—if we are to do this thing,
force is the quickest path available to us.
And you will permit innocent civilians'\nsuffering to see that goal achieved?
Furthermore, our imperial soldiers are\nransacking the villages they occupy. \nWe're no better than common bandits!
As emperor, it is my duty to provide them\nwith spoils of war, so I gave permission\nfor such behavior in order to raise morale.
I have also given them the authority to do\nanything it takes to carry out their mission,\nno matter how inhumane.
Now motivated by greed and sadism,\nour soldiers have demonstrated great\nenthusiasm for their jobs.
You always strove to create a country in\nwhich all of its people could live in peace.
I was once proud to call you my father—\nthe man exalted as the Sage King—\nyet I do not know you anymore.
You are proving quite the nuisance, Valyx.\nI suppose I'll just have to convert you into\na puppet like I did the other generals...
Hmm... He's resisting. Is this because of\nthe dragonblood, or does he do so through\nsheer tyranny of will?

Still, your pathetic little brother Emile was
easily swayed by granting him a sense of
superiority. Perhaps something can be
done with you...
Emile may be a fool at times, but my\nfather would never ridicule him...
Who are you?! And what do you intend\nto accomplish by assuming the guise of\nmy father?!
You would point your sword at me?\nWell then, what will you do if I am indeed \nnot your father?
I will cut you down where you stand\nand set Alberia back on a righteous path.
As I thought. Yet the soldiers of this land\nhave gladly given in to their base natures,\nand that cannot so easily be erased.
Should you kill me now, they will use\nyour actions to justify further insurgence.
A battle for the throne will erupt—\none that will be long and bloody.
The entirety of South Grastaea will\nrun red with the blood of innocents.
Even were that not the case, killing me\nwill accomplish nothing—for this vessel\nbelongs to your father in the end.
If it falls, I will simply find another host.\nPerhaps your older brother? Your sister?\nMaybe even one of the younger ones.
Regardless, your little rebellion would not\nlessen the number of deaths, and would\nmore likely increase it.
Guards, I believe my son requires a bit\nof time to think on his current situation.\nPermit him to do so in the dungeon.

I had time enough to think in my cell, and realized
the thing in my father's form was right: If I led a
rebellion against him, it would quickly erupt into
an all-out war that would divide our nation and
cost the lives of uncountable civilians.
Sacrifices must be made to enact great change,\nbut one must consider exactly WHAT they are\nwilling to sacrifice.
After long deliberation, I requested an audience\nwith the thing in my father's body.
Then that is the solution you've come to?
Yes. I will protect this country as a general\nand follow your orders.

But in exchange, I require full control
of the internal workings of the military,
for I intend to put an end to all pillaging
and other unethical actions.
You may do as you please, so long as it\ndoes not interfere with my will.
Though royalty you may be, your position\nwill be no more lofted than any other\ngeneral of your rank.

The ultimate commander of the military
will still be me, the emperor. In addition,
I will not rescind my permission to pillage
and engage in inhumane warfare.
Thus, your influence over them will have\nno weight, which makes it unlikely any of\nthem will follow your will.
Even still, I will see it done.\nIt is my duty as royalty.
So THAT'S the reason Valyx stayed\nwith the Empire...

Valyx declared the military would stop all
instances of looting and theft, and also
forbade the soldiers from attacking
indiscriminately or without reason.
The other soldiers and generals quickly\ncame to despise him, and soon he was\na pariah to all but his own troops.
But because he was royalty, many of them\nbegrudgingly followed his orders.

Had Valyx had not been keeping an eye
on them from the inside, the casualties
brought on by the imperial army would
have been much, much worse.
Though he mourned the state of his\ncountry, he could not abandon it and\njoin {player_name} so easily.
He had to stop the Empire's rampage from\nthe inside, and so sacrificed himself for\nthe greater good.
Now that I think on it, he may have already\nhad hope for {player_name}\nfrom the very first time they fought...
What do you intend this gathering of yours\nto become in the end?
If you think yourself worthy still,\nfollow me to the forest's heart!
Victory is yours, my brother. This day,\nyou have gained your crown.
...Hope that {player_name} could\nchange the Empire in his stead.
I thought I told you not to say more\nthan was necessary.
But she DID need to say this; we needed\nto know that your actions were all taken\nwith the lives of your people in mind.
Any who harbor ill feelings toward you\nwould see you in a brand new light if\nthis were to become public knowledge.

Yet I failed to rein in the entire military,
and they still undertook countless
atrocities—not the least of which were
those which befell all of you.
There are many I could not save due to\nmy own powerlessness. That is a fact.
But let us turn to other matters: I doubt the\nSvenitlan army is here just to pay a visit.\nDid something happen to the former king?

Um, y-yes... It seems Galkin has taken his
countrymen hostage and begun, um...
making demands to the government.
